description: Benford numbers: a(n)=e^e^...^e (n times) rounded to nearest integer.
comments: The next term, a(4) ~ 2.3315*10^1656520, has 1656521 decimal digits and is therefore too large to be included. [Rephrased by _M. F. Hasler_, May 01 2013]
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
P. R. Turner, Will the "real" real arithmetic please stand up?, Notices Amer. Math. Soc., 38 (1991), 298-304.
formula: a(n) = round(e^e^...^e), where e occurs n times, a(0) = 1 (= e^0). - _Melissa O'Neill_, Jul 04 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
